title: No boys allowed! This Spanish island hotel only allows women
text:
We already have women-only gyms, women-only cruises, women-only island retreats, and scattered around the globe are a few women-only hostels, like Hostelle in Amsterdam - which is very popular with solo female travellers.

Now, the first-ever, women-only hotel has opened its doors, offering luxury single rooms (with double beds!), exclusively to women travellers.

WATCH:Live out your Wonder Woman fantasies on this women-only island retreat

Som Dona Women Only (+14) in Mallorca, Spain is open to women over the age of 14 years old. So, that kind of also means 'no children allowed'.

Close to the stunning Cala Anguila Beach, the hotel has made it its mission to make the hotel a place of comfort, safety and relaxation for women. "At this hotel, you can enjoy the best healthy cuisine made with 'zero-kilometer' products, a wellness area, a pool, free WiFi, comfortable rooms, a bar lounge and a unique atmosphere designed for women," says the hotel.

READ: Spain tightens policies and fines on 'alcohol tourism' with new poster signs in Mallorca

According to Booking.com, the hotel is very popular with solo travellers who have rated it 8.7 for a one-person stay. The cost per night is currently R1 455 per night.
